intro: Pterinodes sensibilis, commonly known as the sensitive pterinodes, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, hairy leaves and showy, pale pink to white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant is native to tropical regions of Africa and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Its leaves are sensitive to touch, often curling when handled, which is a unique botanical feature. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
